content.text:
This patient came in complaining of severe abdominal pain. Why is this an emergency? The patient has: <image 1> 

A. A ruptured gastric ulcer.
B. A ruptured abdominal aortic aneurysm.
C. Acute appendicitis.
D. Acute renal failure.

B. A ruptured abdominal aortic aneurysm.

A ruptured abdominal aortic aneurysm is a medical emergency because it can lead to severe internal bleeding and potentially life-threatening complications if not treated promptly. The CT scan shows a large, irregularly shaped structure in the abdominal aorta, which is characteristic of an abdominal aortic aneurysm.
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
